docs.abstract: Americans without health insurance are for the most part working people who cling to bottom rung of the ladder but who frequently do not qualify for the health care assistance available to the unemployed poor; Census Bureau reports 41 million Americans, or about 15.4 percent of all Americans, lacked health care insurance throughout 1995; among those below Federal poverty line, proportion was 30.2 percent; doctors note a greater incidence of physical and mental disorders among the uninsured; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: It was 7:45 A.M. when Eddie Breedlove, speechless and grasping a swollen jaw, signed the log at the St. Vincent Health Clinic East here. He had roused his wife and their three small children at 5 to make the 50-mile drive from their home in a rattling 16-year-old Mercury, after weeks in which he had been tormented by a relentless toothache. ''He said that last night he drank as much as he could,'' an aide recounted, having interviewed him, ''and then used a pocketknife to try to get it out.''

docs.abstract: Article on Shapedown, pediatric weight-loss and weight-management program at St Charles Hospital, Port Jefferson, NY; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: AT some point in the 12-week weight-loss program for children, the discussion turns to everybody's deepest dread, the teasing. ''At first the children don't want to admit that they've been made fun of, but eventually they speak up,'' saidLorraine Mongiello, a nutritionist and a leader of the Shapedown pediatric weight-management program at St. Charles Hospital in Port Jefferson. ''By the end of the session all the parents are holding back their tears.''
